means: （汽车或自行车）（尤指不用动力向山坡下）滑行
（不用多少动力）快速平稳地移动

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"岸"之意。
means: bank ： 多指有一定坡度的河岸、湖岸或堤岸。
beach ： 指倾斜度小，被海、湖或河水冲刷而有沙或卵石积存的地方。
coast ： 地理学上的名词，专指被视为边界的沿海陆地的尽头。
shore ： 指紧靠大湖泊或海洋的陆地边缘或靠海的休养地。
seaside ： 尤指疗养地、游览地区的海边。

word_mean: 海滩及相邻接的狭窄陆上地带。
在海水面和陆地接触处，经波浪、潮汐、海流等作用下形成的滨海地带。

sentence.Network_en: The boat was anchored off the northern coast of the peninsula.
sentence.Network_cn: 这艘船停泊在离该半岛北部海岸不远的地方。

sentence.Network_en: The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel.
sentence.Network_cn: 从宾馆可以看见大西洋海岸。

sentence.Network_en: He recognized the coast of England through a veil of mist.
sentence.Network_cn: 透过薄雾他认出了那是英格兰的海岸线。

黄金海岸（gold coast）是澳洲最负盛名的渡假盛地，每年都会吸引大约4百万的观光客前往旅游。黄金海岸从布里斯本以南连绵70多 …
澳洲黄金海岸（Gold Coast）是澳大利亚昆士兰州东南海滨休养地，位于布里斯班以南。因绵延长达32千米的金色海滩而得名。
中央海岸（central coast）（Central Coast），是澳大利亚新南威尔士州的一个统计分区，位于悉尼以北及纽卡素以南之间的海岸。现时中海岸所辖之 …

jx.jx_en_mean: there is no danger of being observed or caught

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'side of the body'), from Old French coste (noun), costeier (verb), from Latin costa 'rib, flank, side'. Sense 1 arose from the phrase coast of the sea 'side of the sea'

encyclopedia.content: 词典解释 英音：[kəust]美音：[kost] 名词 n. 1. 海岸；沿海地区 2. 【美】锛埓笮达級美国太平洋沿岸 3. 【美】锛堁┣恋鹊娘級向下滑行；滑行的斜坡

entry.def: The coast is an area of land that is next to the sea.

example.ex: Camp sites are usually situated along the coast, close to beaches.
example.tran: 野营地一般都位于海滨，靠近沙滩。

entry.tran: (车辆熄火后或不用动力)靠惯性滑行
entry.def: If a vehicle coasts somewhere, it continues to move there with the motor switched off, or without being pushed or pedalled.

example.ex: I switched off the engine and coasted round the corner.
example.tran: 我熄掉引擎，靠惯性转过弯去。

example.ex: They picked up momentum, then slipped into neutral and coasted quietly down the slope.
example.tran: 他们加大油门，再切入空挡，随后没大响动地滑下山坡。

entry.tran: 毫不费力地做;(尤指)轻松获胜
entry.def: If a person or a team is coasting, they are doing something easily, especially winning a competition.

example.ex: Ivan Lendl coasted to a 6-3, 6-2, 6-3 victory over Roger Rasheed...
example.tran: 伊万·伦德尔以6:3，6:2和6:3的比分轻松战胜了罗杰·拉希德。

example.ex: The company was coasting on the enormous success of its early products.
example.tran: 公司凭借早期产品的巨大成功而在市场上遥遥领先。

entry.def: If you say that someone is coasting, you are emphasizing that they are not putting enough effort into what they are doing.

example.ex: There was a time when Charles was coasting at school and I should have told him to buckle down.
example.tran: 有一段时间查尔斯在学校不太用功，我当时应该让他加把劲的。

entry.tran: 没有被发现(或捉住)的危险;危险已过
entry.def: If you say that the coast is clear, you mean that there is nobody around to see you or catch you.

example.ex: 'You can come out now,' he called. 'The coast is clear. She's gone.'
example.tran: “你现在可以出来了。”他喊道，“没危险了，她已经走了。”

means.word_mean: 1. the shore of a sea or ocean
2. a slope down which sleds may coast;

sentences.sentence: "when it snowed they made a coast on the golf course"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of moving smoothly along a surface while remaining in contact with it;

sentences.sentence: "his slide didn't stop until the bottom of the hill"
"the children lined up for a coast down the snowy slope"

means.word_mean: 1. move effortlessly; by force of gravity

sentences.en: The south coast is the warmest part of the country.
sentences.cn: 南海岸是这个国家最温暖的地区。

jushi.english: He landed on the coast of South Carolina.
jushi.chinese: 他在南卡罗来纳州海岸登陆。

jushi.english: The program was televised from coast to coast.
jushi.chinese: 这个节目在两个海岸之间各作了电视播放。

jushi.english: Pearls are being cultivated on the South China Sea coast.
jushi.chinese: 南海沿岸在进行珍珠人工养殖。
